title: How to Charge a PS3 Controller

steps.title: Press your PlayStation 3's power switch.
steps.content: Press your PlayStation 3's power switch. You'll find it on the right side of the PS3's front, though early PS3 models may have the power switch on the back of the console instead. Doing this will turn on your PS3.

steps.title: Locate your controller's charger cable.
steps.content: Locate your controller's charger cable. Your PS3 should have come with a USB cable to charge your controller; it has a large end, which is the USB plug, and a small end, which plugs into your PS3 controller. If you don't have a PS3 charger cable, you can purchase a new one from Amazon. Make sure you're using an original Sony charger and not a third-party charger, since non-Sony cables have been proven to be inconsistent.

steps.title: Plug the USB end of the charger into your PS3.
steps.content: Plug the USB end of the charger into your PS3. It should slide into one of the narrow, rectangular slots on the front of your PS3. If the USB end isn't fitting into the PS3's port, rotate the USB end 180 degrees and try it again. The piece of plastic inside of the USB cable needs to fit below the piece of plastic at the top of the USB slot on your PS3.

steps.title: Plug the narrow end of the charger into your PS3 controller.
steps.content: Plug the narrow end of the charger into your PS3 controller. There is a small slot on the front of the PS3 controller; this is where the cable plugs into.

steps.title: Press the controller's power button.
steps.content: Press the controller's power button. It's a circular button with the PlayStation logo on it. You should see a red light appear on the front of your controller.

steps.title: Wait for the controller's light to begin blinking.
steps.content: Wait for the controller's light to begin blinking. Once it does, your PlayStation 3 controller is charging. Leave your controller on the charger cable for at least an hour before disconnecting it.

steps.title: Reset your PS3 controller.
steps.content: Reset your PS3 controller. To do so, insert a pin or a paperclip into the small hole on the bottom of the controller, just below the L2 button.

steps.title: Plug your controller into a different USB port on your PS3.
steps.content: Plug your controller into a different USB port on your PS3. If your controller isnâ€™t charging, this will help determine whether or not the USB port is causing problems.

steps.title: Plug your controller into a computer's USB port and turn it on.
steps.content: Plug your controller into a computer's USB port and turn it on. While you can't charge a PS3 controller on a computer, your controller will still light up if you press its power button while it is attached to a computer. If the controller doesn't light up, the problem is with the cable.

steps.title: Use a different charger cable.
steps.content: Use a different charger cable. In some cases, the problem may lie with a faulty or defective USB cord. Third-party USB cables often don't work with PlayStation technology, so if you buy a new cable, make sure it's from Sony.
